alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 15 at 7:24AM CDT until May 15 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN SHAWNEE...SOUTHEASTERN WABAUNSEE...NORTHERN OSAGE AND NORTHEASTERN LYON COUNTIES... At 724 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles south of Harveyville, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 713 AM a trained spotter reported half dollar size hail in Eskridge. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Osage City, Carbondale, Auburn, Overbrook, Lyndon, Burlingame, Scranton, Harveyville and Pomona Lake. This includes Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 151 and 170. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
